src:
Član Čukov sporoča: Po desetih letih je čas za novo
Lani so Čuki praznovali 30 let nastopanja na slovenski glasbeni sceni. Leta 1998, ko je skupino zapustil klaviaturist Marjan Malovrh, se jim je pridružil Matjaž Končan. K Čukom ga je povabil njegov bratranec Jože Potrebuješ.
06 Nov 2019, 15:25 by Mojca Marot



Že 21 let je član najbolj priljubljene skupine Čuki. Foto osebni arhiv



Veliko časa preživi v delavnici, v kateri izdeluje harmonike pod lastno blagovno znamko Končan. Foto osebni arhiv



Pevec z mamo Olgo in očetom Francem. Foto osebni arhiv



Matjaž s svojo harmoniko. Foto osebni arhiv


Simpatični Matjaž je na odru vedno nasmejan, o zasebnem življenju pa ne govori rad. Zato mnogim ni znano niti to, da se je rodil v glasbeni družini, saj sta bila že njegov oče in stari oče znana ljudska godca. Oče Franc je igral v ansamblu s še dvema sorodnikoma, za njimi pa je več kot 500 preigranih ohceti. Pri nekaterih se jim je z baritonom pridružil tudi Matjaž. Njegov starejši brat Franci poje pri več zborih in vodi kvartet, mama Olga pa je bila vokalistka v dekliškem zboru. »Tako sem že tretji v rodu, ki igram harmoniko,« se nasmeji. »V glasbeni šoli sem začel igrati klarinet, nato sem pri 11 letih prvič vzel v roke frajtonarico.


Matjaž s svojo harmoniko. Foto osebni arhiv

Izvedel sem, da jo poučuje priznani glasbenik Niko Zajc. Za prvo srečanje sva se dogovorila po telefonu, in ko sva se srečala, se je odločil, da me bo učil. Z Vrhnike sem se z avtobusom vozil v Nožice pri Kamniku na vaje, učne ure pa plačeval iz lastne žepnine, ki sem jo zaslužil, ko sem očetu pomagal pri električarskih delih. Cele popoldneve sem porabil za to, da sem se eno uro lahko učil pri Niku,« nam razloži glasbenik, ki danes igra harmoniko, klaviature in bariton, za svojo dušo pa tu in tam zabrenka na kitaro.Zelo rad se spominja prvih nastopov pri rosnih 16 letih, ko so z dvema prijateljema igrali na ohcetih in se imenovali trio Gojzar. »Leta 1994 sem pri osemnajstih prvič igral harmoniko na Triglavu, kamor se z Vrhnike vsako leto odpravi od 100 do 120 planincev. Igrali smo tri dni skupaj, celo ponoči, spali sploh nismo. Ko smo se vrnili domov, smo se ustavili v eni od gostiln in tam še naprej igrali. To so res lepi spomini,« nam Matjaž z nasmehom na ustih odstira glasbene začetke.


Pevec z mamo Olgo in očetom Francem. Foto osebni arhiv

V triu Gojzar je igral približno pet let, potem je moral na služenje vojaškega roka. Po vrnitvi iz vojske ga je bratranec Jože Potrebuješ že začel nagovarjati, da bi se pridružil Čukom, in Matjaž je njegovo povabilo seveda sprejel. Danes se lahko pohvali še kot dober učitelj harmonike, saj že več kot 20 let uspešno prenaša svoje znanje. Od leta 2003 sam izdeluje harmonike ter s tem znanje, ki ga je pridobil na lesarski šoli, in ljubezni do lesa izkazuje v ročno in estetsko izdelanih harmonikah Končan. Z znanjem komercialista uspešno vodi svoj posel, na kar je zelo ponosen, kaj bolj osebnega pa je težko izvleči iz njega. Vseeno nam zaupa, da je kuhinja področje, na katerem se res ne znajde. »Zelo sem sladkosneden, nisem pa velik gurman. Hitro sem lačen in lakoto prav tako hitro potešim, saj me dobra hrana vedno premami, le zelenjavi se raje izognem,« nam smeje se zaupa Matjaž, ki za smukanje po kuhinji niti nima časa. Čuki so pač še vedno ena najbolj zasedenih glasbenih skupin pri nas. Letošnje poletje je bilo zanje izjemno naporno. »Upam, da bom jeseni našel čas, da še sebi naredim novo harmoniko. Na eno igram že deset let, zato je res čas, da si za svojo dušo izdelam novo,« nam še pove simpatični glasbenik.


Veliko časa preživi v delavnici, v kateri izdeluje harmonike pod lastno blagovno znamko Končan. Foto osebni arhiv
text:
Member of Chukov reports: After ten years, it's time for a new one
Last year, Chuki celebrated 30 years of performing on the Slovenian music scene. In 1998, when keyboardist Marjan Malovrh left the group, Matjaz Koncan joined them. His cousin, Joze Nebo, invited him to Chek.
06 Nov 2019, 15:25 by Mojca Marot



He has been a member of the most popular Chuki group for 21 years. Photo personal archive



She spends a lot of time in a workshop where she produces harmonics under her own brand, Finished. Photo personal archive



Singer with mother Olga and father Franz. Photo personal archive



Matjaz with his accordion. Photo personal archive


Cute Matjaž is always smiling on stage, but he doesn't like to talk about his private life. Therefore, it is not known to many that he was born into a musical family, since both his father and old father were well-known folk gods. Father Francis played in an ensemble with two other relatives, with more than 500 playful octets behind them. For some, Matjaz joined them with the baritone. His older brother Franci sings in several choirs and conducts a quartet, and his mother, Olga, has been a vocalist for the girls' choir. "I'm already the third in the line to play the accordion," he laughs. “I started playing clarinet at a music school, and then at the age of 11 I picked up a freitone.


Matjaz with his accordion. Photo personal archive

I learned that she was taught by renowned musician Niko Zajc. We arranged the first meeting by phone, and when we met, he decided to teach me. From Vrhnika I took a bus to Nožice pri Kamniku for rehearsals, and I paid for my lessons from my own pocket money, which I earned when I helped my father with electrical work. I spent the whole afternoon so I could study at Nico's for an hour, "explains the musician, who today plays accordion, keyboards and baritone, and for his soul he has a guitar jam here and there. 16 years when he and his two friends played on dens and called themselves the Gojzar trio. “In 1994, at the age of eighteen, I played the accordion for the first time at Triglav, where 100 to 120 mountaineers depart from Vrhnika every year. We played for three days together, even at night, we didn't sleep at all. When we got home, we stopped at one of the pubs and continued to play there. These are really fond memories, ”Matjaz makes a musical start with his smile.


Singer with mother Olga and father Franz. Photo personal archive

He played in the Gojzar trio for about five years, after which he had to serve military service. Upon his return from the army, his cousin Joze Need You already began to persuade him to join the Chukas, and Matjaz, of course, accepted his invitation. Today he can be praised as a good accordion teacher, since he has successfully transferred his knowledge for over 20 years. Since 2003, he has been producing accordions himself, thereby acquiring the knowledge he has acquired at the Woodworking School and demonstrating his love of wood in handmade and aesthetically made accordions. With the knowledge of a salesman, he successfully runs his business, which he is very proud of, and more difficult to get out of his personal life. However, he trusts that the kitchen is an area he really does not find himself in. “I'm very sweet, but I'm not a big gourmet. I am hungry quickly and I am also quick to satisfy hunger, as good food always lures me, I prefer to avoid vegetables, ”says Matjaž, who even has no time to smack in the kitchen. Chuchi is still one of the busiest bands in our country. This summer has been extremely challenging for them. “I hope to find time in the fall to make a new accordion for myself. I've been playing for ten years, so it's really time for me to make something new for my soul, "a sympathetic musician tells us.


She spends a lot of time in a workshop where she produces harmonics under her own brand, Finished. Photo personal archive
